headline: These Lemongrass-Scented Chicken Satay Were Made to Dunk in Tangy Peanut Sauce
description: This chicken satay recipe calls for lemongrass in the slightly spicy marinade and in the bright, tangy peanut dipping sauce.
name: These Lemongrass-Scented Chicken Satay Were Made to Dunk in Tangy Peanut Sauce
recipeIngredient: 3 plump lemongrass stalks—bottom 8 inches only, outer layer removed, stalk cut into 2-inch lengths
2 tablespoons canola oil, plus more for grilling
4 pounds skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 plump lemongrass stalk—bottom 8 inches only, outer layer removed, stalk cut into 2-inch lengths

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the lemongrass, shallots, garlic, brown sugar, coriander, cumin, turmeric, fish sauce, salt and 2 tablespoons of the canola oil in a blender and process into a paste. Transfer the marinade to a bowl and add the chicken, gently tossing to coat each piece. Thread the coated chicken pieces onto 12-inch skewers and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, up to 8 hours. Meanwhile, prepare the peanut sauce

Heat the canola oil in a medium saucepan. Add the shallots, garlic, lemongrass, jalapeño, and ginger and cook over moderate heat, stirring, until the aromatics are softened and browned, about 10 minutes. Scrape the mixture into a food processor. Add all of the remaining ingredients along with 1/2 cup of water and process into a slightly chunky paste.

Scrape the peanut paste back into the saucepan over low heat and cook, stirring frequently, until sauce is very thick and and the fat separates, about 20 minutes. The peanut sauce will turn a deeper shade of brown. Whisk in 1/2 cup of hot water until incorporated. Keep the peanut sauce warm over very low heat.
Light a grill and oil the grates. Grill the chicken skewers over moderately high heat, turning occasionally, until charred in spots and cooked through, 10 to 12 minutes. Serve with the peanut sauce.

review.reviewBody: This was disgusting. SO many different components so I expected it to at least taste decent. So gross. I searched for 5 star and top rated chicken satay. Turns out the only reviews here are terrible so where are the 1700 5 stars from?! What a waste of time and money. Ordering pizza tonight.
Read reviews and then reread recipe: 1.5 TABLEspoons coriander?? Other recipes don’t have it at all or use TEAspoon measurements. Agree with other reviewers and won’t be using this recipe.

This recipe is horrible. The cumin and coriander are overpowering in the marinade and I used half of what they suggested and the peanut sauce texture is just awful. Keep looking for another recipe, do not waste your time on this one.

Flavor was okay, but the texture was gross. Would not recommend. Side note- I was very disturbed to find the previous reviewers who pointed out the issue with the rating and source code. I'll find it hard to trust recipes from this site in the future
Where did these ratings come from? There are no reviews?
Why are the ratings hardcoded into the source code?

item.name: These Lemongrass-Scented Chicken Satay Were Made to Dunk in Tangy Peanut Sauce
